brief: Automate LiveOps event scheduling and reward distribution for multiplayer games.

sections.problem_statement: Game developers face challenges in efficiently managing LiveOps events for multiplayer games, which are crucial for player engagement and retention. Manual scheduling and reward distribution processes are time-consuming, error-prone, and lack scalability. There is a need for an automated system that can streamline event planning, execution, and reward distribution, ensuring timely and accurate delivery of in-game events and prizes to players across different time zones and game instances.

goals_and_success_metrics.success_metric: Reduce event setup time by 80% compared to manual processes
Achieve 99.9% accuracy in reward delivery to players
Enable 50% more LiveOps events per month without increasing staff workload
Increase daily active users by 25% within 3 months of implementation

user_stories.story: I want to easily create and schedule LiveOps events through a user-friendly interface so that I can plan multiple events in advance without manual intervention.
I want to set up event reward tiers and distribution rules so that players automatically receive their prizes based on their performance or participation.
I want to receive timely notifications about upcoming events and instantly get my rewards after participating so that I stay engaged and motivated to play more.
I want to access real-time analytics on event participation and reward distribution so that I can make data-driven decisions for future events and game updates.

constraints: Must integrate with existing game backend systems and databases
Should support multiple time zones for global player base
Must comply with data protection regulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA)
Should handle high concurrency during popular events without performance degradation
Must provide secure authentication for administrative access to event management tools

sections.hypothesis: Automating LiveOps event scheduling will increase player engagement by 20%
sections.rationale: Automated scheduling can ensure more frequent and timely events, keeping players consistently engaged. It can also optimize event timing based on player activity patterns.
sections.test: Implement automated scheduling for a subset of games and compare player engagement metrics (daily active users, session length, etc.) with manually scheduled games over a 3-month period.

sections.hypothesis: Automated reward distribution will improve player satisfaction scores by 15%
sections.rationale: Instant and accurate reward distribution eliminates delays and errors, leading to a more satisfying player experience. This can increase trust in the game's systems and overall enjoyment.
sections.test: Survey player satisfaction before and after implementing automated reward distribution. Compare satisfaction scores and analyze feedback related to reward systems.

sections.hypothesis: Automation will reduce LiveOps management time by 50%, allowing for more creative event design
sections.rationale: By eliminating manual scheduling and reward distribution tasks, the LiveOps team can focus more on creating innovative and engaging event concepts.
sections.test: Track time spent on LiveOps management tasks before and after automation. Measure the number and complexity of new event types introduced in the following quarter.

sections.hypothesis: Automated LiveOps will increase in-game purchases by 10% due to more targeted and timely events
sections.rationale: With automation, events can be more precisely timed and tailored to player segments, potentially encouraging more in-game purchases during peak engagement periods.
sections.test: Compare in-game purchase rates between games using automated LiveOps and those using manual systems over a 6-month period, controlling for other variables.
